title.native: アイドルマスターシンデレラガールズ 2nd SEASON

description: The second season of THE iDOLM@STER Cinderella Girls.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

title.native: アイドルマスターシンデレラガールズ
アイドルマスター シンデレラガールズ Anytime, Anywhere with Cinderella.

node.description:
Former adult game scenario writer. He is a creator of cult classic Shizuku, Kizuato and To Heart.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_takahasi)
Since around 2012, Shingo Tamaki has been actively involved in [diomedéa](https://anilist.co/studio/51/diomeda) productions.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamada_uk) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/22HS_drill/) Originating from [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). Works outside anime: - Melty Blood: Type Lumina (Video Game, 2021) (Cut-in Animation Character Design, Animation Director, Key Animation)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/880805780844183553)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). 

Freelancer originating from [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/), formerly a [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) employee. 

Married to [Akira Amemiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100956/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/94072097)

Close friends with [Kai Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/132094/).

Married to fellow Animator [Reiko Nagasawa](https://anilist.co/staff/140343).

[Twitter](https://x.com/kg_ui) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/kgui.bsky.social) | [Pixiv](https://kagaai.fanbox.cc/) | [Tumblr](https://kiki223.tumblr.com/)

Admires, and is heavily inspired by both [Naoko Yamada](https://anilist.co/staff/102498/) and [Yuusuke Matsuo](https://anilist.co/staff/114311/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/waiwaiburanko3) | [Tumblr](https://waiwaiburanko.tumblr.com/)

**Notable works outside anime:**
- Fate/Samurai Remnant (Video Game, 2023) (OP Director, Key Animation)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sushio_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sushiogumicompany/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%99%E3%81%97%E3%81%8A)

Ishizaki Toshio, better known as Sushio, is an animator, illustrator and character designer working for [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/).

After graduating from Yoyogi Animation Academy, he joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). He debuted as an in-betweener in [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/), as a key animator on [Berserk](https://anilist.co/anime/33/), and as an animation director on [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/276/). In 2007, he served as a character designer for the first time on [Kiss Dum: Engage Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/2106/). He was a key staff member at Gainax for a long time, but left in 2011 when [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/) and others established the anime production company Trigger. There he was given the job of handling the character designs for [Kill la Kill](https://anilist.co/anime/18679/), the first TV series produced by the newly-found studio.

Specializes in action and effects, and his skills attract a lot of attention in the industry.

Took part as a key animator on Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" in 2003.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sushio_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sushiogumicompany/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%99%E3%81%97%E3%81%8A)

Ishizaki Toshio, better known as Sushio, is an animator, illustrator and character designer working for [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/).

After graduating from Yoyogi Animation Academy, he joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). He debuted as an in-betweener in [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/), as a key animator on [Berserk](https://anilist.co/anime/33/), and as an animation director on [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/276/). In 2007, he served as a character designer for the first time on [Kiss Dum: Engage Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/2106/). He was a key staff member at Gainax for a long time, but left in 2011 when [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/) and others established the anime production company Trigger. There he was given the job of handling the character designs for [Kill la Kill](https://anilist.co/anime/18679/), the first TV series produced by the newly-found studio.

Specializes in action and effects, and his skills attract a lot of attention in the industry.

Took part as a key animator on Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" in 2003.

(Source: Wikipedia)

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - Who is in the pumpkin carriage?
Episode 2 - I have never seen such a beautiful castle.
Episode 3 - A ball is resplendent, enjoyable, and...
Episode 4 - Everyday life, really full of joy!
Episode 5 - I don't want to become a wallflower
Episode 6 - Finally, our day has come!
Episode 7 - I wonder where I  find the light I shine…
Episode 8 - I want you to know my hidden heart.
Episode 9 - "Sweet" is a magical word to make you happy!
Episode 10 - Our world is full of joy!

Episode 12 - The magic needed for a flower to bloom.

Episode 15 - When the spell is broken...
Episode 16 - The light shines in my heart.
Episode 17 - Where does this road lead to?
Episode 18 - A little bit of courage shows your way.
Episode 19 - If you're lost, let's sing aloud!

Episode 21 - Crown for each.
Episode 22 - The best place to see the stars.
Episode 23 - Glass Slippers.
Episode 24 - Barefoot Girl.
Episode 25 - Cinderella Girls at the Ball.
